name: Club Quarters Boston

reviews.text: I'd like to acknowledge Marina Navarro, she has done an excellent work! I feel truly comfortable ere
reviews.title: Really excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to give this place a rave review. I can't honestly think of one negative point I found. For the price and location in Downtown Boston Financial District you can't go wrong. Easy walking to Fanuel Hall/Quincy Market, Boston Common, even a cab from the airport is pretty cheap. They even had a cab waiting outside of the hotel door when I checked out at 6am on a Sunday. Loved the clean room. Bathroom spotless, linens spotless, walls clean and the carpet is so clean you don't have to fear walking on it barefoot. Descent sized, even with many bags you don't feel cramped. Nice flat screen tv and heater/ac in room so you can control the temperature, black out curtains, coffee maker. Check in and out is fantastically fast and the front desk girls who greeted me at the door were great. Free wifi, free internet on computers in the lounge and if that's not enough you can even print your boarding pass for free. Free connectors for computers in the rooms and in the lounge. Also free filtered water on each floor and a closet to grab extra blankets and ironing boards, irons, extra coffee ect. There is also an Elephant & Castle Pub adjacent to the hotel making it easy to grab a quick bite or a drink. I wish every hotel was like this and there would be no need for tripadvisor.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC

reviews.text: Interesting concept here, you check in yourself, via a touch screen. You get an impression that this is a no frills stay you are about to undertake.
reviews.title: 2 nights stay at the club quarters Boston

reviews.text: The room was fine, I booked a standard room, it had a king size bed, coffee maker, flat screen tv, great black out curtains. Adequate bathroom.
reviews.title: The Best Value and Service in Boston's Financial District

reviews.text: Ok the negatives. I was unfortunate to have a room with an adjoining door and the guy next door felt he had to listen to sad eighties love songs and sing along to them at 2 am !!
reviews.title: Great Location - Close to Faneiul Hall Area & Downtown
Prime location, esp for tourists
reviews.text: Room was small, but as expected for a downtown hotel and quite comfortable. Most Boston tourist attractions (and a couple of T stations) are a short walk away and airport access is a breeze. Facilities are not lavish, but provided what was needed. I can fully recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: so-so
reviews.text: We stayed 10/5 -10/8. All the previous reviews are accurate. Nothing stellar, nothing awful. The best part was the free bottled waters and proximity to what we wanted to see.

reviews.title: Okay, not 'luxury'.
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location for walking. The financial area goes 'dead' after quitting time so you'll have to walk over to Fanueil Square for any action or restaurants. Only about a ten minute walk.

reviews.title: Adequate but Housekeeping Could Improve
reviews.text: Location is good. Cleanliness was okay. Don't expect anything resembling a great, luxurious experience. It's more like a nice dorm. If you want romantic and impressive, go elsewhere, but this is certainly adequate for business travelers or vacationers who just want a nice, clean place to stay. Service was good and friendly. when I asked for a roll away bed in the morning, it was there in the room when I came back from my day's activities.

reviews.title: Great location & accomodations!
reviews.text: Again, don't expect luxury, but it was cheaper than some hotels and it was easy to get places. Close walk to subways, South Station etc. You can walk to the North End for Italian dinners. Weekends are packed. Get to a restaurant early because by 8pm you'll have at least an hour or hour and a half wait to get in anywhere.

reviews.title: Would stay here again!
reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect from Club Quarters because I paid so little compared to other area hotels. Well, I ended up pleasantly surprised! I booked this hotel for one night because it was so close to TD Banknorth Garden.

reviews.title: In the Club
reviews.text: Upon arrival I used the self-check-in kiosk and it was quite fast. I hopped on the elevator and was a little confused at first... you have to first slide your room key and then choose your floor. When you get off the elevator there is free bottled water to your right, very nice touch.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed on the 9th floor in a street facing room. The room was small, but for two people we didn't need a ton of space. The bed had clean linens and was quite comfy. The bathroom was clean and offered soap, shampoo and mouthwash. The shower was very tiny, our bathroom got a little flooded because the curtain was so small. The room also had a flatscreen tv.

reviews.title: Would Stay Here Again!
reviews.text: I loved how quiet this hotel was! Often when I stay in hotels I am woken up by the other guests because of thin walls or by room service. However, we were able to sleep late and never heard another person in the hotel. Also, check out is 12 which is considerably later than a lot of the other hotels in downtown.

reviews.title: Great location, very clean
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again! It was a pleasant stay and great deal.

I had flown to Boston from Wellington New Zealand to embark on a cruise from there. The time taken was 17 hours in the air and I was nearing exaustion. ( I am 75)....A welcome arrival, easy registering on a computer, A great room and most of all a bed that was not flying at hundreds of miles an hour. Luggage at Boston Airport was 1 1/2 hours coming off so that just added to my woes, nonethe less my experience was all good and the coffee shop right next door was fabulous. I MUST have been jetlagged as afterwads I could not find my room, I was in 3 19 and looked for 913...Found it soon enough. Lost the rubber tip from my cane but the obliging desk clerk returned to my room and found it under the bed just as the taxi arrived. Altogether a most satisfing stay and I would recommend the hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: A great relief to a long journey.

likes.liked: — Easy to get to from airport, Central location, reasonable price (Inportant)

reviews.title: Small with no frills
reviews.text: We stayed one night to be near a wedding. Since we have two kids ages 14 and 11, we chose a suite. Well the suite was smaller than any single hotel room we had ever seen. The double bed was okay, but the pullout sofa was shear torture. The bathroom was extremely small and only included a shower stall. The TV on the wall, with a swing arm bracket, was nice and the fridge and microwave were efficient. The room was clean. The staff was minimal.

I spent the better part of a year in Boston and once I discovered this hotel it was my preferred lodging. This is a membership hotel (as in, you or your company have to buy a membership to stay here).
reviews.title: Great hotel, convenient location

likes.disliked: — sometimes only one of the two elevators worked for a number of days at a time

reviews.text: For the location, rates were very reasonable.
reviews.title: Great Place, helpful staff and amazing beds

reviews.text: Rooms are clean & efficient (some might think small).
reviews.title: Great, but super tiny!

reviews.text: Great hotel, great location. Minutes walk from Fanueil Hall and many other attractions. Hotel is a little tricky to find, just look for the Elephant ant Castle Pub which is connected to it. They offer reduced parking 2 blocks away and you can easily cut through the pub to save walking. Rooms were very nice and clean. Shockingly, each floor offers free bottled water.....instead of $4.00 for a liter like most chain hotels. The club room on the first floor offers coffee, tea and has 2 computers (with printers) available at all times. All in all, I couldn't have been happier for the price that I paid. ($80 priceline)
reviews.title: Club Quarter's Boston..Great hotel, great location

likes.liked: — Nice, clean rooms....it didn't hurt that there was a pub connected to the hotel.

reviews.text: This is a far more pleasant place to stay than the nearby, very expensive Ritz Carlton, at one-third the price, where we stayed several days before sampling the Club Quarters on our return trip. True, you don't have tje R-C's snotty help condescending to extend faux cheery "good mornings", but you have more comfortable rooms at one-third the price. Instead of a sterile, incredibly expensive dining room ($65 for a mediocre breakfast for two), you get a reasonably priced meal in a cheery adjacent pub. The exercise room is not as fancy, but it's free, as opposed to the R-C's $25, and you optionally can have a stationary bicycle or elliptical machine delivered to your room, for free of course. If you enjoy in-room coffee, forget the R-C, which doesn't have it, and go to the Club Quarters, which has an unlimited supply.
reviews.title: Efficiently excellent

reviews.text: True, the R-C has fast 801.2g wifi, while the Club Quarters has (rather inexcusably) only the slow (11 mbs) 801.2b wifi, but the R-C charges $10 a day, while the Club Quarters provides it for free. Anyway, the R-C's nominal fast internet frequently slows to levels slower than dialup (10-15 kps), so it doesn't matter.
reviews.title: Rent a bed

reviews.text: The Club Quarters is not perfect, of course. Something is wrong with the TV system (which is the exact same as at the R-C), so that it is hard to find services other than the standard TV stations. It says it offers HD TV, but I couldn't find it.. However, the Club Quarters offered two wide-screen plasma TV's while the R-C has one, standard TV. While the Club Quaters TV has extensive inputs for PC's, they appear to have been disabled. (The Ritz Carlton had no such inputs). Exterior lights bathe the windows, so the curtains must be drawn at night. The Air Conditioning is quite noisy.
reviews.title: Poor attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But, even without the associated major savings, the Club Quarters is the superior hotel.
reviews.title: not so great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was right in the center of Downtown. It was a few blocks from the Freedom Trail & Feneuil Hall. It was clean. Beds were comfy. Staff was friendly. Prices were reasonable. They offer free coffee from the Keurig 24/7 & purified water in bottles on every floor. The only negatives were there is no parking (it cost $40 from Friday night to Sunday at noon) at 33 Arch St & the hotel does not offer discounts there & the room was a bit small.
reviews.title: Reasonable, clean hotel in the heart of Boston

reviews.text: I have stayed here a few times, and each time it has been pretty good. Rooms are small, tv's are small, no mini bar or anything like that. Its a business travelers hotel, so the frills are not there. The beds are a bit hard, and they had no extra pillows or blankets available. On my last trip I found out that the doors to the rooms have no soundproofing at all. I was awoken several times by people talking in the hall, and it sounds as if the door is open. Always clean and the employees are always friendly and helpful. In the end, I will stay elsewhere from now on.
reviews.title: Fine for some

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed here for one night to celebrate a delayed valentines. After having dinner and bar hopping throughout fenuille hall we came back to the room to crash. The location could not have been better and though our stay was short, the little touches like our towels folded into elephants and warm welcoming receptionist made us feel like we were valued regulars. This cozy nook is our new secret staycation and will be seeing more of us shortly.
reviews.title: Staycation

reviews.text: I stay frequently at this hotel because I travel for work and work in the financial district when in town. The kiosk check in and out is awkward and the fact you have to check out and not get a receipt under your door is a pain. Additionally I think they should splurge and have irons in every room versus in the "guest closet"- this is my one main pet peeve with this hotel.
reviews.title: Ok but some things were kind of awkward

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that, it is a fine hotel, small, clean and good location and the staff aims to please.
reviews.title: Great service...

reviews.text: I first found out about this hotel through our corporate booking agent. It really is a hidden gem in Boston for the cost concious business or leisure traveller. It's best described as "compact" but the rooms are perfectly functional. It's an easy walk to the Finanical District, and Fenuille Hall, as well as other major tourist attractions. The hotel itself adjoins the excellent Elephant & Castle Pub; but room service can come from many local restaurants. For value for money I don't think this place can be beaten in it's location.
reviews.title: A hidden gem

reviews.text: We spent only one night at club quarters in one of the coldest weekends of the winter. The hotel was small but impressively comfortable, the staff at the reception was very helpful and the location was great. We'll definitely come back!
reviews.title: Excellent Price-Quality Ration, Excellent Location

reviews.text: Rooms are a bit small but the price is phenomenal for what you get. Dont know how they make a profit. Super nice staff.
reviews.title: Great value, service, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great experience with the Club Quarters Boston. We arrived a little earlier than planned and they already had our room ready. The room was clean, well maintained and felt modern and fresh. It was a good size, had a quiet (and working) temperature system that kept us comfy the whole time. The whole atmosphere of the hotel was luxurious. The bathroom needed some re-grouting but it too was clean. Our bed was HUGE (i think they pushed two twins together since there was an uncomfortable seam in the middle) but we slept great. I loved the filtered water stations - WAY better than the nasty ice and tap water at other hotels. I didn't realize until we were checking out that we we could have had pieces of exercise equipment brought to the room! I would have done that. We were just a short walk from TD Garden, Quincy Market, Boston Common and a hundred other amazing things. The service was impeccable. I'm sorry we didn't get a chance to eat at the pub downstairs cause it looked like a neat place. When we checked out they offered to hold our bags for a few hours - which was extremely helpful so we weren't stuck lugging our heavy bags around Quincy Market. We WILL DEFINITELY be staying here again and I will be recommending this place to everyone I know looking for a place to stay. Thank you for making our weekend getaway perfect and stress free.
reviews.title: Luxury at afforadable prices!

reviews.text: Customer service is what brings me back somewhere, and club quarters is doing everything right. A native resident in the area, a few friends and I reserved 3 Kitchenette suits with a full size bed and pull out couch to enjoy the evening in town.
reviews.title: All requests were Completed to full expectation with a smile.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This the 3rd Club Quarters we have used having previously stayed at locations in London and Chicago. The location is excellent, room was very clean and the front desk staff were great. The only downside was that the bed wasn't as comfortable as the London and Chicago locations.
reviews.title: Great location, service

reviews.text: The location is great and most everything is within walking distance or a short trip on the subway. For those arriving into Logan avoid the $25 cab fare. There is a free shuttle bus to the Blue Line subway station. Buy a $2 ticket and take the 3 stops to State St and it is a 2 minute walk to the hotel.
reviews.title: Satisfying on the whole

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like the good and convenient location. Staffs are friendly and ready to help, so are the cleaning ladies.
reviews.title: Everything you could want, at the best location

reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband for 4 days in early March. Compared to others in the area the Club Quarters was well priced and maintained a strong TA rating. Deservedly so.
reviews.title: Okay for business travelers if your company is footing the bill

reviews.text: The room was clean and spacious for such a central location. There was also plenty of storgae space and free filtered water. There is a coffee machine in the room but no tea (you can not get good tea anywhere in Boston!!). The communal area, the club room, also has free refreshements and newspapers and free internet and printer.
reviews.title: Definitely recommend!

description: Private, full service club-like hotel with 178 rooms located in the heart of downtown near Faneuil Hall, North End, Freedom Trail, Quincy Market and Post Office Square and a short walk from fine dining, shopping and entertainment. Club Quarter is the best value hotel based on quality and the prime location. Club Quarters provide:• Safe, restricted entry• Instant registration and check out• Free high speed internet access throughout the hotel• Onsite restaurant • Multi-menu in room dining options (through onsite restaurant and many local restaurants)• Refrigerator and microwave available• Unlimited complimentary chilled purified bottled water • 3 meeting and event rooms available (maximum reception style 50 people)• Free use of computer/printer • Ergonomic workstations• State of the art guest rooms with premium bedding• Contemporary furnishings• Flat panel HD TVs• Complimentary coffee and tea• 24 hour guest service desk • Fitness room • Exercise equipment delivered to guest room upon request • Corporate Apartments available • Value rates• Government per diem rates 365 day a year with valid ID.
